title: How to Combine Different Videos into a Video Fusion
text: How to Combine Different Videos into a Video Fusion , 8 September 2015 -- Often, you may want to combine cool videos you’ve just shot or captured to make a movie or extended video clip. Joining videos and creating fun messages, short films, or video collages is a great way to spend time, but to make it really enjoyable, you need a simple and effective tool to merge video files. We know how to do that. AllPepole Video Merger offers an easy way to join your videos together and also lets you edit movies in many different ways. Step 1. Install the Software for Joining Videos Download AllPepole Video Merger and launch installation file. Setup the program following the Installation instructions and just in couple of minutes the program will be ready to help you with combining videos into one file. Step 2. Add Media Files and Choose the Editing Mode Click Add Media Files and pick the files you want to join. If you want to work with a DVD video, use the Add DVD option. To join several 3D videos click the corresponding button. To simply join your videos, use the Storyboard mode. Now go to the Media tab and drag your files to the working area in order you want them to be joined. Step 3. Apply Transitions to Joined Videos As you moved your files into the working area, you can join them. It takes just a couple of clicks – just add stylish transitions between the clips. To do this, open the Fades panel, drag the transition you want into the working area, and place it between any two video fragments. Then click the chosen transition in the working area, expand the Settings panel and set the timing and other animation parameters. That’s all there is to it. Step 4. Save Your Project Now save your video in the format of your choice. Click Save Movie, then choose from these variants: save as a video file, save as 3D video, burn to DVD, upload to your YouTube, Vimeo or Facebook, or convert for viewing on your mobile phone or tablet. It doesn't matter if you joined only the AVI files or video fragments in different formats, the resulting file will be saved as a video file or converted for a mobile device in the format you've chosen. Select the required output preset in the pop-up window and click Save. You can choose any video format, including AVI, MPEG, WMV, MP4, FLV, MOV, and different formats of HD video. When the file is saved, the folder containing the joined video will open automatically. Allpepole Video Merger at Mac APP store: Tips: This tutorial refers to AllPepole Video Merger for Windows. If you use Mac, please check out the instructions for Mac users. # # #
